newsitem.title: USA: Tobacco shrs jump after Fla. jury acquits Reynolds.
newsitem.headline: Tobacco shrs jump after Fla. jury acquits Reynolds.

text.p: Tobacco stocks soared higher in afternoon trading on Monday after a Florida jury ruled that R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co was not negligent in the death of deceased former smoker.

Tobacco shares erased declines of between one and two points to post solid gains by late session before the shares were halted for trading. Industry giant Philip Morris Cos Inc stock was up 5/8 at 40-1/2 after being down 1-7/8 most of the day. Number-two RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp, the parent company of Reynolds, was off 1/8 at 29-1/2, having pared losses from 28-3/8.
The American Stock Exchange Tobacco Index was up 14.97 points, or 5.26 percent, at 299.46.

Despite the lift the stocks got from the decision, traders and analysts harbored some pessimism about the longer-term outlook and pointed to the settlement talks between the tobacco industry as a more significant factor in values.

"The talks are the bigger determinant of stock price values and so I would argue that this is good for the talks, but it won't have a particularly substantial effect," said Martin Feldman, tobacco analyst at Smith Barney.
